title: Bethell’s 4-11 seals England 3-0 sweep over Sri Lanka in World Cup warm-ups
byline: Jacob Bethell delivered a sensational late spell as England edged Sri Lanka by 12 runs to complete a 3-0 clean sweep in the T20 World Cup warm-up series.

title: SriLankan Airlines CEO search draws 200 applications
byline: National carrier SriLankan Airlines has received around 200 applications for the post of Chief Executive Officer, Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Janitha Ruwan Kodithuwakku told Parliament yesterday.

title: Namal says he will cooperate with any investigation
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser and Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa said he is prepared to cooperate with any investigation summoned by authorities, accusing the government of using law enforcement agencies to conceal its own failures.

title: CEJ urges govt. to close plastic bag profit loophole
byline: The Centre for Environmental Justice (CEJ) has called on the government to urgently address a regulatory gap that allows companies to earn substantial profits by charging consumers for plastic bags without directing any of that revenue toward environmental conservation.

title: Tourist arrivals hit record high in January kicking off 2026 with strong momentum
byline: ​Sri Lanka’s tourism industry has recorded a historic start to the new year, with arrivals in January 2026 surging to an all-time monthly high of 277,327 visitors.

title: Arsenal reach EFL Cup final as Havertz goal beats Chelsea
byline: Arsenal took a step closer to winning their first major silverware since 2020 as they beat Chelsea to reach the Carabao Cup final.

title: Local construction sector urged to move beyond ‘survival mode’
byline: Sri Lanka’s construction industry must move decisively from “survival mode” to “growth mode” and reposition itself as a core driver of the national economy rather than a purely domestic service sector, the newly appointed President of the Chamber of Construction Industry of Sri Lanka (CCI), Vernon Manilal Fernando said.

title: Rew century leads England into ICC U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup final
byline: Thomas Rew’s century led England to a 27-run victory over Australia and a place in the ICC U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup 2026 final.

title: Group B Preview: Co-hosts’ big opportunity at T20 World Cup
byline: Group B promises a tight contest as Australia and co-hosts Sri Lanka look to navigate a tricky pool packed with rising challengers.

title: Cabinet approves tenders for 160 MW/640 MWh national battery storage project
byline: In a significant step towards strengthening the country’s electricity system, Cabinet this week approved awarding tenders for the installation of a 160 MW/640 MWh battery energy storage system, Energy Ministry said.

title: T20 World Cup 2026: ICC expresses concerns over Pakistan’s India match boycott
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) on Wednesday expressed concern after Pakistan declined to play against India in the group stage of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, prompting the global governing body to explore diplomatic channels to resolve the issue.

title: Colonialism has become active in a different form today: Sajith
byline: Colonialism has become active in a different form in Sri Lanka and other countries in the Southern Hemisphere, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Govt.’s ’Protection of Occupants Bill’ under fire
byline: The proposed ‘Protection of Occupants Bill’ is under fire as it has got three foreign companies to leave Sri Lanka while eight other local companies are expected to file fundamental rights cases against it, an Opposition MP told Parliament yesterday.

title: Govt. justifies emergency coal purchases
byline: Amidst Opposition claims that the country will have to incur losses if the government will have to go for emergency coal purchases, Power and Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody said yesterday emergency coal purchases will not incur losses adding that only 300,000 metric tons of coal will be procured under emergency purchases.

title: Sri Lanka’s dream of becoming an oil-producing nation hits a snag
byline: Sri Lanka’s ambition to become an oil-producing nation has faced a setback, with the planned international tender process for offshore oil and gas exploration and development delayed due to a court case initiated in the past, an official said yesterday.

title: Spain announces plans to ban social media for under-16s
byline: Spain has become the latest European country to make plans to ban social media for children under the age of 16.

title: Striving to elevate country into more advanced, resilient, dignified State: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said with unwavering resolve, the government is striving to elevate the country into a more advanced, resilient and dignified State than it has ever been.

title: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of ex-Libyan leader, reportedly shot dead
byline: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of Libya’s former leader Col Muammar Gaddafi, has reportedly been shot dead.

title: Spin-heavy Pakistan hit form, but India boycott risks early T20 exit
byline: Pakistan’s spin-heavy squad are in winning form ahead of the T20 World Cup, but a controversial decision to forfeit their marquee clash against India could still trigger another early exit.

title: Independence Day sees major promotion drive in Sri Lanka Army
byline: In line with the 78th Independence Day celebrations on 04 February 2026, the Sri Lanka Army has promoted 9,158 Other Ranks from both the Regular and Volunteer Forces to their next respective ranks.

title: Human Rights Watch warns US heading to ’authoritarianism’
byline: Human Rights Watch warned Wednesday, February 4 that President Donald Trump was turning the United States into an authoritarian state as democracy declines globally to its lowest ebb in four decades.

title: Appeal Court quashes summons issued on former President Sirisena over Easter Sunday attacks
byline: The Court of Appeal yesterday issued a Writ of Certiorari quashing the summons issued by the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court on former President Maithripala Sirisena over the Easter Sunday terror attack incidents.

title: Sabina Youssef returns after 3rd place finish at Miss World Married Woman Competition
byline: Sabina Youssef, who represented Sri Lanka at the 41st Miss World Married Woman competition held in the United States, returned to the country in the early hours today after securing third place and winning the Miss Photo Genie title.

title: Leopard cub spotted climbing tree to escape dogs in Bogawantalawa
byline: A leopard cub was captured on a mobile phone by a tea estate worker in the Bogawantalawa area yesterday (3), after it climbed a tree to escape a group of dogs while accompanying its mother on a hunt.

title: Graduate teacher recruitment exams gazetted
byline: Applications have been called from graduates in the public service as well as graduates not currently employed in the public service for the recruitment of Sinhala, Tamil and English medium teachers to national and provincial schools islandwide under the Sri Lanka Teachers Service.

title: Severe lightning and thundershowers forecast
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are expected in parts of the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as in the Galle and Matara districts, according to the Meteorological Department said.

title: ’We still engaged in struggle to complete our independence’: President
byline: Claiming that the true fulfilment of independence lies in the extent to which Sri Lankans are able to achieve economic freedom, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today that he believes that people are still engaged in a struggle to complete independence.

title: Sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha arrive in Sri Lanka
byline: The sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago, marking a historic moment for Buddhists in the country.

title: Group B preview: Co-hosts’ big opportunity at T20 World Cup
byline: What an opportunity co-hosts Sri Lanka have to qualify in pole position of the Super Eight stage of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026.

title: Kilinochchi families of the disappeared protest on Independence Day
byline: Relatives of persons who went missing during Sri Lanka’s decades-long civil war staged a protest in Kilinochchi town today (04), coinciding with the country’s 78th Independence Day, declaring that they have no true freedom without their missing loved ones.

title: World leaders reaffirm support as Sri Lanka marks 78th Independence Day
byline: As Sri Lanka celebrated its 78th Independence Day today under the theme ’’Building Sri Lanka,’’ world leaders from across the globe extended their warm wishes, reaffirming bilateral ties and pledging continued support for the island nation’s economic recovery and development.

title: UNP preparing for new generation leadership: Ranil
byline: The United National Party (UNP) is preparing for a new generation leadership that would embrace smart politics, party leader former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Sri Lankan delegation meets Rahul Gandhi
byline: Ven. Udugama Sarananda Thera, the Chief Incumbent of Sri Shasanalankararamaya Purana Maha Viharaya (Udugama Maha Viharaya), together with the Custodian Nilames of the Viharaya, met with Indian Opposition Leader Rahul Gandhi in New Delhi today to convey their gratitude in remembrance of the late Prime Minister of India, Indira Gandhi.

title: Snooker legend Virgo dies aged 79
byline: John Virgo, the snooker legend, has died at the age of 79; Virgo’s most notable victory was in the final of the 1979 UK Championship, where he defeated Terry Griffiths; he was also co-host of the Big Break television show

title: Collision with Greek coast guard boat leaves 15 migrants dead
byline: At least 15 migrants have died after a speedboat carrying them collided with a Greek coast guard vessel off the coast of the island of Chios late on Tuesday.

title: Human Rights Watch warns US heading to ’authoritarianism’
byline: Human Rights Watch warned Wednesday, February 4 that President Donald Trump was turning the United States into an authoritarian state as democracy declines globally to its lowest ebb in four decades.

title: Mrs World 2nd Runner-Up Sabina Yousaf returns
byline: Sabina Yousaf, who represented Sri Lanka at the 41st Mrs World pageant in the United States, returned to the country yesterday following an impressive performance at the international competition, where she secured the Second Runner-Up title and won the Mrs Photogenic mini-title while also placing among the Top 20 contestants.

title: T20 World Cup 2026: ICC expresses concerns over Pakistan’s India match boycott
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) on Wednesday expressed concern after Pakistan declined to play against India in the group stage of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, prompting the global governing body to explore diplomatic channels to resolve the issue.
